poem:
A Wake-Up Call  

Europe's tangled wires hum  
with whispers, a silicon dance—  
Beijing's shadow stretches.  

In microchips, the world clatters—  
engine hearts in cold standoff—  
factories sigh in limbo.  

Bold ministers at their chess,  
would do it all again—  
nations perched on circuits,  
hoping not to short.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I’d do it all again,’ says Dutch minister at heart of car chip standoff with China A bitter battle over the future of a Chinese-owned chipmaker in the Netherlands that threatened to cripple the global car industry is a “wake-up call to Europe and the west”, the minister at the heart of the row has warned. The six-week standoff between the EU and Beijing over Nexperia and its vital supplies of automotive semiconductors has served". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
